data.title: Deep whole-genome sequencing reveals recent selection signatures linked to evolution and disease risk of Japanese
data.meta_description: AbstractUnderstanding natural selection is crucial to unveiling evolution of modern humans. Here, we report natural selection signatures in the Japanese population using 2234 high-depth whole-genome sequence (WGS) data (25.9×). Using rare singletons, we identify signals of very recent selection for the past 2000–3000 years in multiple loci (ADH cluster, MHC region,BRAP-ALDH2,SERHL2). In large-scale genome-wide association study (GWAS) dataset (n = 171,176), variants with selection signatures show enrichmen…
data.text:
Polygenic effects on the risk of Alzheimer’s disease in the Japanese population
